title: Fat Bodoni (almost like Sahara Bodoni)
content:
Can anyone help me with an ID of this Bodoni.

The closest I can find is [Sahara Bodoni](http://web.archive.org/web/20141029192430/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/sahara-bodoni/sahara-bodoni)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141029192430im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bodoni_4280.jpg)
author: peter_monrad

comments.content: Looks like [Big Figgins by Matthew Carter](http://web.archive.org/web/20141029192430/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/SerifGuide/sample.php?id=1&sample=full#) aka Elephant. Don’t ask me where to get it. I dunno.

Normande is very close too, but not quite. It does have an italic.

[http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=normande](http://web.archive.org/web/20141029192430/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=normande "http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=normande")

The only digital Elephany I'm aware of is the Carter & Cone/Microsoft copyrighted version that MS [bundled with a group of products](http://web.archive.org/web/20141029192430/http:/www.microsoft.com/typography/fonts/font.aspx?FID=94&FNAME=Elephant&FVER=1.51) years ago.

OK. So Elephant (later renamed Big Figgins) came bundled with some [Microsoft products](http://web.archive.org/web/20141029192430/http:/www.microsoft.com/typography/fonts/font.aspx?FID=94&FNAME=Elephant&FVER=1.51) until about 2003. Seems to have vanished since then.

_by Matthew Carter aka Elephant._

For a second there I thought you were saying Matthew Carter had a pet name in the typographic community....

_... Matthew Carter aka Elephant_

:-D

Uh ... sorry, Mr. Carter. Wasn’t on purpose.
Haha! He’s certainly a heavyweight in the world of type design. Or should I say an _éminence gris_?

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141029192430im_/http:/typophile.com/files/julieranoa2c_3599.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141029192430im_/http:/typophile.com/files/erinmask4_6710.png)

I love Big Figgins. It’s a pleasure to use and its kerned very well.

Mikey :-)

Thanks for your help. It is indeed a great font and I'm amazed, that it's not possible to buy it anywhere.

I guess I can always buy an old copy of Office 97 and get if from there.

Actually, you have to purchase it by calling Cherie Cone at Carter & Cone:

[http://www.carterandcone.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141029192430/http:/www.carterandcone.com/ "http://www.carterandcone.com/")

This is how I got Big Figgins.

Hope you like using it.

Mikey :-)

Big Figgins is now sold by Ascender Fonts.

Mike Diaz :-)
